item.title: Report E-2025020032
item.description:
Report E-2025020032

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-07
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 06:57 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UBY) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper packaging, approximately 1 gallon of Sodium Hydroxide - Nu-Brite Cleaner (hazardous - UN3266) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor at dock door #85. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of UN3266 Sodium Hydroxide product released to a 6’ x 6’ area of the trailer floor and a 4’x4’ area on the wall of the trailer due to the cap of the tote popping off. The top was replaced, and it was ensured it was seated properly. Sodium Bicarbonate solution was used to neutralize the impacted areas. Contractors containerized impacted rags, PPE and poly sheeting into (1) 55-gallon poly. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2025020055
item.description:
Report X-2025020055

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-16
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 1/16/2025 at approximately 1000, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4835830 at the heavyweight facility in San Diego, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of 10 buckets of paint that were overpacked onto a wooden pallet. The shipment sustained damage due to a forklift incident. 1 of the 10 buckets was punctured, resulting in spillage. The damaged bucket was inverted and placed in a salvage drum for disposal. The remaining pieces of the shipment will continue forward in transit upon receipt of an amended Shipper's Declaration of Dangerous Goods.

  • City: SACRAMENTO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET, TORN AND RETAPED. DAMAGED DURING OVERHEAD SORTATION. LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING OBSCURED BY SHIPPING LABEL. ONE BOTTLE MISSING. THREE BOTTLES LEAKED FROM CAPS OFF OR LOOSE. ALL GOODS SOILED. SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2025011302
item.description:
Report X-2025011302

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was damaged at facility RLTO. No DPR was done, nor was it entered into DGnav. Package was repacked and forwarded to destination MPGR without an LQ diamond on the new outer packaging. Cannot confirm whether or not the original packaging had an LQ diamond, and as a result I am entering this as undeclared. Package discovered by QA while working damaged packages and was flagged as a hazmat. 2 bottles in package. Both damaged.
